body_html:
Sorry I meant,

export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda-9.0/"

I am not an expert I was just trying to help since I had a similar issue on ubuntu 18.04 with tensorflow-gpu. So, did you have the /usr/local/cuda-9.0/ folder? Just in case, try to echo your environment variables and see if there is LD_LIBRARY_PATH.

I hope maybe it will help
body_text:
Sorry  I meant,
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda-9.0/"

I am not an expert I was just trying to help since I had a similar issue on ubuntu 18.04 with tensorflow-gpu. So, did you have the /usr/local/cuda-9.0/ folder? Just in case, try to echo your environment variables and see if there is LD_LIBRARY_PATH.
I hope maybe it will help
body:
Sorry  I meant,
```
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/usr/local/cuda-9.0/"
```
I am not an expert I was just trying to help since I had a similar issue on ubuntu 18.04 with `tensorflow-gpu`. So, did you have the `/usr/local/cuda-9.0/` folder? Just in case, try to echo your environment variables and see if there is LD_LIBRARY_PATH. 

I hope maybe it will help
